revised_title: Magnetic Variations and Observations in the Atlantic Ocean
tldr: This article discusses the author's research on magnetic variation in the Atlantic Ocean between 60 degrees North and 60 degrees South latitude. The author presents maps of magnetic declination and discusses the influence of iron on magnetic observations made on board ships. The author also proposes a new method for correcting magnetic observations and compares magnetic declinations computed by M. Gauss's general theory with those derived from observation.
